post.description: Simulates an inbound customer payment request (pacs.008) sent from a T2 scheme participant into ClearBank to a ClearBank customer.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API token, obtained from the ClearBank Portal.

parameters.name: DigitalSignature
parameters.description: Signed hash of the body of the request. The hash is signed by your private key.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the request; valid for 24 hours, max length 83.

post.description: Simulates an inbound financial institution payment request (pacs.009) sent from a T2 scheme participant into ClearBank to a ClearBank customer.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API token, obtained from the ClearBank Portal.

parameters.name: DigitalSignature
parameters.description: Signed hash of the body of the request. The hash is signed by your private key.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the request; valid for 24 hours, max length 83.

post.description: Trigger inbound payment return request (Pacs004) to simulate a payment being returned from a T2 scheme participant into ClearBank to a ClearBank customer.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API token, obtained from the ClearBank Portal.

parameters.name: DigitalSignature
parameters.description: Signed hash of the body of the request. The hash is signed by your private key.

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the request; valid for 24 hours, max length 83.

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code for the transaction. Set to EUR.

iban.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identifier used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer. Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

streetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

buildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

buildingName.description: Name of the building or house.

postCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

townName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

country.description: Two-letter ISO country code for a nation with its own government.

BusinessApplicationHeader.description: Information used by SWIFT for routing.

bizMsgId.description: Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message. Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.

from.description: The sending party BIC. For testing, set to CLRBNL2AXXX.

messageNameId.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers.

CreditorAgent.description: Information that identifies the creditor agent as a financial institution.

purposeCode.description: Underlying reason for the payment transaction, as published in an external purpose code list.

country.description: Two-letter ISO country code for the country of birth.

DebtorAgent.description: Information that identifies the debtor agent as a financial institution.

FinancialInstitutionCreditTransfer.Credi.description: Details about the creditor's financial institution.

FinancialInstitutionCreditTransfer.Debto.description: Details about the debtor financial institution.

settlementAmount.description: Indicates the amount used in a given transaction or account balance.

settlementCurrency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code for the settlement's currency. Set to EUR.

purposeCode.description: Underlying reason for the credit transfer, as published in an external purpose code list.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the party

InitiatingParty.description: The initiating party of the payment.

countryOfResidence.description: Two-letter ISO country code for the country of residence.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the party

bic.description: The instructing agent's BIC. For testing, set to CLRBNL2AXXX.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the party
Legal Entity Identifier of the party

identification.description: Unambiguous Identification for the given scheme.

issuer.description: The name of the entity that assigns the identification.

PartyIdentification.description: If Postal Address is present then Name is mandatory. If AnyBIC is absent then Name is mandatory.

name.description: Name of the party. Mandatory if postal address is present, or if anyBic is absent.

countryOfResidence.description: Two-letter ISO country code for the country of residence.

instructionId.description: Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

endToEndId.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the initiating party, to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

uetr.description: Universally unique identifier to provide an end-to-end reference of a payment transaction.

chargesInformation.description: Any charges imposed on the return.

PrivateIdentification.description: The ultimate creditor’s private or personal information.

RelatedRemittanceInformation.description: Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the party

amount.description: Indicates the amount used in a given transaction or account balance.

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code for the transaction. Set to EUR.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the party
Legal Entity Identifier of the party
Legal Entity Identifier of the party
Legal Entity Identifier of the party

Returns.OriginalGroupInformation.description: Details about the group the payment was originally sent to to be returned.

messageId.description: Point to point reference, as assigned by the original instructing party, to unambiguously identify the original message.

messageNameId.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the party
Legal Entity Identifier of the party
Legal Entity Identifier of the party

Returns.ReturnChain.description: The chain through which the payment was returned.

countryOfResidence.description: Two-letter ISO country code for the country of residence.

code.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in the SWIFT ExternalReturnReason1Code list.

endToEndId.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the initiating party, to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

uetr.description: Universally unique identifier to provide an end-to-end reference of a payment transaction.

instructionId.description: Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

SchemeName.description: Items to identify the scheme name.

code.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

proprietary.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a free text form.

UltimateCreditor.description: The ultimate creditor of the payment.

countryOfResidence.description: Two-letter ISO country code for the country of residence.

UltimateDebtor.description: The ultimate debtor of the payment.

countryOfResidence.description: Two-letter ISO country code for the country of residence.

settlementAmount.description: Indicates the amount used in a given transaction or account balance.

settlementCurrency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code for the settlement's currency. Set to EUR.
